page.title: 12Tamar Valley, Pentillie Est.
page.content: The Pentillie Estate has been part of{ {local history}since the year 1242 but today is run as a modern{farming} concern. There are eight tenanted farms specialising mainly in dairy herds but with some beef and sheep rearing and a little arable farming. 'Home Farm' also has about 400 acres of grass keep which is put out to tender. At Tinnel Farm a{flying}crop-spraying business has been started using helicopters which provides a service for local as well as distant farms. A large area of the estate, some 420 acres, is given over to woodlands, mainly of a broadleaf variety, which provides ample cover for large numbers of pheasants and other game. Shooting rights are let out to individuals or syndicates who wish to take part in this special kind of{recreation.
